page.title: 03Farming Around Himbleton (2)
page.content: The intensive systems of farming in this area are mainly Dairying and Cereals , together with some poultry production - this being Turkeys for the Christmas trade. The cereals grown are on the whole winter varieties , i.e. those planted in September and October for harvesting the following year. The princepal types being Wheat and Barley with some Oats , Beans and Rape. The reason for the choice of winter corn is mainly the clay soil which retains nutrients and moisture. This allows for greater yealds of grain - up to 3.5 tonnes per acre for both Wheat and Barley. The Wheat is either used for milling into flour or for cattle feed. The Barley is mostly used for cattle feed.
